nodes.bodyText: Just to confirm this supports markers?
Not yet, as per the comment.
What's the worst case of making this threadlocal? Or perhaps trying to use java.time through method handles, falling back to the legacy API?
Is this ever closed? E.g. when the program shuts down? Does it need closing? It would be hard to know whose responsibility it is to close the stream if it could by System.err or System.out.
I don't think there is a problem with not closing the stream, since there is usually only one of them, and it will be closed when the JVM exits. Worst case is that something isn't flushed properly.
